image.altText: A man looks up wearing a black hat, glasses and a blue long sleeve shirt.

props.synopsis: An expert in international law says unless the alleged offender hands himself in, it's unlikely he will face a Queensland court anytime soon.

title.children: Foreign national who allegedly poured hot coffee on baby may be 'very difficult to locate'

image.altText: Selfie of Chinchilla couple accused of murdering Kaydence  Mills

props.synopsis: A Queensland judge has found a 44-year-old man guilty of the murder of two-year-old Chinchilla toddler Kaydence Hazel Mills.

title.children: Man guilty for murder and torture of Chinchilla toddler hit her head with bamboo stick for not going to the toilet

image.altText: a woman standing in front of microphones and tv cameras at a press conference

props.synopsis: Former Gold Coast mayoral candidate Virginia Freebody is living in crisis accommodation with her daughter after forgetting to re-sign her lease while grieving her husband's death.

title.children: Former Gold Coast mayoral candidate and her daughter homeless as rental stress grows

image.altText: Juice bottles seized by police.

props.synopsis: AFP launched its investigation in May after the Canada Border Services Agency allegedly identified the illicit drugs hidden in juice bottles, which had arrived in Vancouver from Brazil.

title.children: Police foil alleged plot to smuggle liquid meth into Australia in juice bottles

image.altText: Emergency crews around a crashed plane.

props.synopsis: A light plane has crashed south-west of Brisbane, with emergency crews working to free the pilot.

title.children: Pilot injured after becoming trapped in a light plane wreckage south-west of Brisbane

image.altText: Tom Dearden

props.synopsis: Reuben Cotter and Tom Dearden are leading the Cowboys' NRL finals campaign in their first year as North Queensland captains.

title.children: One season into their captaincy, Cowboys Cotter and Dearden take the team to a semifinal

image.altText: A man and a cute dog

props.synopsis: Brewer Stuart Martin ran a pub that sold "dog beers" on tap until he was dobbed in for breaking Australia's food safety rules. Now he is campaigning for national laws to change.

title.children: Stuart used to serve 'dog beer' in his pet-friendly pub — but then a customer dobbed him in

image.altText: A quiet cityscape, taken in the early daylight hours.

props.synopsis: The chilly temperatures Queensland has been experiencing this week are a stark difference to the warmer days the state saw earlier.

title.children: Parts of Queensland drop to -2.5C in coldest September morning in 10 years

image.altText: A court sketch of Ryan W. Routh, suspected of attempting to assassinate Donald Trump.

props.synopsis: The suspect in an apparent assassination attempt on Donald Trump has appeared in court. This is what we learned from Mr Routh's first court appearance, documents provided to the court, and what could happen next.

title.children: What the court documents tell us about the apparent second attempt on Trump's life

image.altText: A man leans down and works on a garden bed

props.synopsis: Les Stephson is not letting his age get in the way of maintaining his "pride and joy" — his garden, where he goes to remember his wife who died a year ago.

title.children: 95-year-old keeps garden dream alive as flower festival gets underway after beloved wife's passing

image.altText: Young Indian woman wearing a grey shirt.

props.synopsis: Indian students make up the second-largest group of international students in Australia, but opportunistic agents are scamming students out of hundreds of thousands of dollars.

title.children: Scores of Indian families fall victim to multi-million-dollar Australian visa fraud

image.altText: Houses under construction on a bright, sunny day

props.synopsis: An announcement that 13,700 new homes will be supported through the government's flagship housing fund has come before details have been finalised.

title.children: Federal government unaware of size of social housing spend, with some projects set to take years

image.altText: Composite image of Vladimir Putin and Xi Jinping

props.synopsis: The Russian and Chinese economies are lurching into ever more perilous territory, threatening the nations' alliance.

title.children: Isolated on the world stage, Russia turned to China. Now it's suffering from a power imbalance

image.altText: Campaign Underway: Composite image of Queensland Opposition Leader David Crisafulli and Premier Steven Miles.

props.synopsis: Premier Steven Miles has been in Brisbane talking cost-of-living support, while the opposition leader travelled to Cairns to announce plans for two youth justice schools if elected.

title.children: Major parties hit the road in lead-up to Queensland election

image.altText: A sculpture of a face and head with red lips and the skill absent showing the outline of a brain

props.synopsis: Many of the risk factors for dementia – being female, growing older and the genetic lottery — cannot be avoided. But research is uncovering a growing list of ways to cut your risk.

title.children: The 14 risk factors to watch for as dementia cases set to skyrocket

image.altText: Senate House of Reps generic composite

props.synopsis: Welcome to that time of the political cycle where we find ourselves burrowing into the election date speculation rabbit hole.

title.children: Could we have a double dissolution election on the Australia Day weekend? Technically yes, but probably no

image.altText: A woman with red hair sits at her home computer.

props.synopsis: Tech giants have split over WFH rights, with many Australian businesses adopting hybrid approaches to when and how people need to attend work.

title.children: Amazon orders all workers back into office as some Australian companies embrace flexibility

image.altText: An Indigenous man stands in front of a tree.

props.synopsis: Over almost 20 years, Indigenous leader Geoff Clark siphoned about $1 million from his community. Here's how the police finally caught him in a story only now able to be told.

title.children: How Operation Omega brought down former ATSIC head Geoff Clark

image.altText: High shot of tropical island

props.synopsis: Phone and internet outages are causing chaos for tourism businesses at one of Queensland's most popular tourist spots, Magnetic Island.

title.children: Travellers warned of phone, internet outages at popular tourist island as school holidays start

image.altText: An elevated view of the Big Red Bash campsite and stage area, the sun on the horizon in the background.

props.synopsis: From races and rodeos to festivals and fairs, event tourism is the lifeblood for many businesses in outback Queensland, but towns are bracing for a bleak tourism season next year as the cost of living crisis puts the crunch on iconic events.

title.children: Can outback tourism survive without one of its biggest events?

image.altText: Alleged would-be Trump shooter Ryan Routh

props.synopsis: An investigation into the digital footprint of Donald Trump's alleged would-be assassin Ryan Routh paints a vivid and contradictory picture of his mindset.

title.children: Here's what we know about Ryan Routh, the man behind the second assassination attempt on Trump

image.altText: A man in a suit stares at the camera.

props.synopsis: In July, the government appointed an anti-Semitism envoy and announced an Islamophobia equivalent would soon follow. Ten weeks on, the Islamophobia position remains vacant.

title.children: 'Almost farcical': Two months after the anti-Semitism envoy was appointed, there is still no Islamophobia envoy

image.altText: Pro-Russian soldiers sit atop a tank with Russian flag flying.

props.synopsis: Russian President Vladimir Putin orders the country's military to increase its number of troops to a total of 1.5 million, as Moscow's military action in Ukraine drags on for more than two-and-a-half years.

title.children: Vladimir Putin orders Russian military to boost troops by 180,000.

image.altText: Sean "Diddy" Combs dressed in a suit and bowtie not smiling

props.synopsis: Details of the charges weren't immediately clear but it follows a March raid of Combs's Los Angeles and Miami mansions.

title.children: Rap mogul Sean 'Diddy' Combs arrested in New York after federal indictment

image.altText: OceanGate Titan submersible floating at the surface of the ocean

props.synopsis: A coastguard hearing into the death of five people on the Titan submersible is told the crew reported being "all good here" in the lead-up to the implosion during a dive to the Titanic.

title.children: Titan crew reported being 'all good here' before disaster

image.altText: Two women look at a share price board outside the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis: The ASX 200 closed on another record high on Tuesday, as traders waited for crucial two-day US Fed Reserve meeting to begin. Catch up on the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX 200 closes on fresh record high, as traders wait for two-day US Fed meeting to start — as it happened

image.altText: A composite image of newspaper clippings following the disappearance of Amber Haigh.

props.synopsis: When the young woman vanished, police stumbled across what they believed to be a sinister plot to take her baby boy. But despite a lengthy murder trial, what happened to her remains one of regional Australia's enduring mysteries.

title.children: Allegations of forced surrogacies, tied-up schoolgirls: How Amber Haigh's disappearance brought ominous rumours into the limelight

image.altText: The southern lights shimmer over a thick level of cloud.

props.synopsis: The conditions are ripe for people at the bottom of Australia to catch a glimpse of the southern lights, space weather forecasters say.

title.children: Aurora australis set to be visible in Tasmania and parts of Victoria tonight

image.altText: Kelp forest in Tasmania with fish and diver

props.synopsis: Tasmania has built a brand off it's clean, green identity. But a new state of the environment report — the first in 15 years — paints a different picture.

title.children: After 15 years, the Tasmanian government has handed down a State of the Environment report. It doesn't look good

image.altText: Melbourne Metro city loop train

props.synopsis: Few cities in the world could be classified as a 15-minute city, according to new international research.

title.children: Europe doing better at creating 15-minute cities than Australia, research finds

image.altText: Andrew O'Keefe, dressed in a suit and tie, arrives at Downing Centre Local court

props.synopsis: The 52-year-old was arrested on Monday after being hospitalised for a suspected drug overdose. Police allegedly later found crystal meth in his vehicle.

title.children: Prison the 'best thing' for former TV star Andrew O'Keefe, magistrate says

image.altText: Adam Goodes, sitting down, smiles at someone in the foreground who is standing up. There are people sitting around him

props.synopsis: The former Sydney Swans great explains why he wouldn't change even his most harrowing moments. Goodes also shared why he now wears his skin colour as a badge of honour and the "really weird" fan item he signed.

title.children: How one of Adam Goodes' most challenging moments led him to his wife

image.altText: graphic of different number plates under the black and white number plate 8

props.synopsis: A rare South Australian number plate has sold for a staggering $2.3 million in a "hectic" online auction.

title.children: Number 8 number plate sells for 'price of a nice villa' after 11th hour bidding war

image.altText: 2 Little Green Island

props.synopsis: British-American movie producer and actor Douglas Gresham sells Little Green Island to a North Queensland family, putting it back in Australian hands.

title.children: This Australian island sold at a beachside auction in just 15 minutes for $5.6 million
